sentences.en: an ear of corn
sentences.cn: 玉米穗

sentences.en: Brand's keen ear caught the trace of an accent.
sentences.cn: 布兰德敏锐的耳朵听出了口音。

sentences.en: Build her up with kindness and a sympathetic ear.
sentences.cn: 用友善和富有同情心的倾听来重拾她的信心。

sentences.en: Ear pain of any kind must never be ignored.
sentences.cn: 决不要忽视耳部的任何疼痛。

sentences.en: he claimed to have the prime minister's ear.
sentences.cn: 他声称总理也听取他的意见。

sentences.en: He pulled the stub of a pencil from behind his ear.
sentences.cn: 他从耳后拿出一小段铅笔头。

sentences.en: He suddenly cocked an ear and listened.
sentences.cn: 他突然竖起耳朵仔细倾听。

sentences.en: Hearing can be affected by ear wax blocking the ear canal.
sentences.cn: 耳垢堵塞耳道可能会影响听力。

sentences.en: Her ear, shoulder and hip are in a straight line.
sentences.cn: 她的耳朵、肩膀和髋部呈一条直线。

sentences.en: I'm up to my ears in work here.
sentences.cn: 我工作忙极了。

sentences.en: If you want to tell your story, we're all ears.
sentences.cn: 你想讲故事的话，我们会全神贯注地听的

sentences.en: John found he was kissing and nibbling her ear.
sentences.cn: 约翰意识到自己在亲吻并轻咬她的耳朵。

sentences.en: she brought her world crashing about her ears.
sentences.cn: 她彻底毁了自己的生活。

sentences.en: She dabbed a drop of the musky perfume behind each ear.
sentences.cn: 她在两耳后分别擦上一小滴麝香香水。

sentences.en: She sat on Rossi's knee as he whispered in her ear.
sentences.cn: 她坐在罗西的膝盖上，听他低声耳语。

sentences.en: She tucked her hair behind her ears.
sentences.cn: 她把头发拢到耳朵背后。

sentences.en: Simon finished dialing and clamped the phone to his ear.
sentences.cn: 西蒙拨完号，把听筒贴在耳边。

sentences.en: that man's got money coming out of his ears.
sentences.cn: 那人非常有钱。

sentences.en: That rubbish goes in one ear and out the other.
sentences.cn: 那种废话都是左耳进，右耳出。

sentences.en: The treatment involves the placement of twenty-two electrodes in the inner ear.
sentences.cn: 这一治疗需要在内耳放置22个电极。

sentences.en: The woman prodded her neighbour and whispered urgently in his ear.
sentences.cn: 那位女士捅了捅邻座，急切地在他耳边低语。

sentences.en: whatever he tells me seems to go in one ear and out the other.
sentences.cn: 无论他给我讲什么，我都是左耳进右耳出。

sentences.en: You need a good ear to master the piano.
sentences.cn: 弹好钢琴需要有敏锐的辨音能力。

sentences.en: Zita was herself unconventional, keeping a safety-pin stuck through her ear lobe.
sentences.cn: 齐塔自己就不守传统，在一只耳垂上穿了一根别针。

words.tran_cn: 无穗的；无耳的；听觉不佳的

phrases.tran_cn: [口语]耳朵被打肿，(被打得)青肿的耳朵
(非正式)全神贯注地听，洗耳恭听
(非正式)不光彩地被打发走（或被解雇）
使某事（尤指不幸）发生在自己身上
耳朵发烧(意指有人背后议论) [戏谑语]

phrases.phrase: give an ear 或 lend an ear
grin (或 smile) from ear to ear
have (或 keep) an ear to the ground
phrases.tran_cn: 十分了解事态的进展，保持敏锐
对...听觉灵敏；对...有鉴赏力

phrases.phrase: have an ear to the ground 或 keep an ear to the ground
phrases.tran_cn: 敏锐，精明：注意新动向或信息
在某人那儿能说上话，能接近并影响某人

phrases.phrase: have something coming out of one's ears
in (at) one ear and out (at) the other

phrases.tran_cn: 心不在焉地听，似听非听
（因被人谈论或批评而）耳朵在发热
随机行事；无计划地进行
乳臭未干的；少不更事的；初出茅庐的

trans.tran_cn: 耳（朵），辨音力，倾听，（谷类的）穗
trans.tran_en: one of the organs on either side of your head that you hear with
one of the organs on either side of your head that you hear with
